metadata.title: CVE-2025-21635 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:rds: sysctl: rds_tcp_{rcv,snd}buf: avoid using current->nsproxyAs mentioned in a previous commit of this series, using the 'net'structure via 'current' is not recommended for different reasons:- Inconsistency: getting info from the reader's/writer's netns vs only  from the opener's netns.- current->nsproxy can be NULL in some cases, resulting in an 'Oops'  (null-ptr-deref), e.g. when the current task is exiting, as spotted by  syzbot [1] using acct(2).The per-netns structure can be obtained from the table->data usingcontainer_of(), then the 'net' one can be retrieved from the listensocket (if available).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2025-21635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-generic - 3.13.0-173.224
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-lowlatency - 3.13.0-173.224
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1054.58
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-173.224').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.58').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
